resources.string: Soduko is a game where the goal is to fill all 3x3 squares and all rows and columns with the numbers 1 through 9.
Firstly pick your difficulty by clicking on one of them from the pop-up dialog.

You will then be presented with a board like this. Manipulating the squares is done by choosing and action from in the bottom of the screen and then clicking on a square. The numbers 1–9 places down that number, and \'Erase\' erases the square you click on.
You can also toggle a colorization of a number in a cell. This is done by choosing the \'Color\' action and clicking on a cell.
Continue filling out the cells until you come to a solution. Remember that a valid Sudoku puzzle has only one solution.

When you are done filling out all the cells a prompt will come up saying if you solved it correctly or not. By exiting the prompt you can continue editing the puzzle and try again without having to start from scratch.
Firstly fill in all your values that you want the puzzle to start with pre filled.
You then have to click the button that says \'LOCK\'. This will lock those numbers and prevent you from editing them further. They should now be shown as bold.
You now have to fill in the correct solution to the puzzle.
When you are done with that you can press \'SAVE\' and choose a difficulty for your puzzle.
